text:
`pie de página` is correct, but like too formal. for dev. we use header/footer too.
so something like `Mover jQuery al footer` is the descriptive way but don't know if that fit.
So perhaps just "footer jQuery" would be fine?

hmm, if you know that this is an option you can get what it does. Otherwise it feels a bit clueless.
We need a kind of tooltip or something to expand the information about the options or a kind of tutorial first-time run to explain a bit in depth I guess.

Well I feel like the hover state of the buttons kind of clues you in to what it does. 

My personal opinion on it is - we can have a wiki page explaining what things do with the extension. Overall though I think I’d rather design the extension in such a way that it is easy to understand, and have the wiki page be supplemental in-case we couldn’t solve that problem.
You are right though even the hoverstates dont explain the buttons entirely, since they just reveal what they do. so it would be good to have some additional information in some way.
<@U7ADCU3BM> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7ADCU3BM/FBLFE55CK/2018-07-07_18_09_22-edit_page.png|I was thinking in something more like this>

but actually. I like how the hover is managed because you can see exactly what it does. 
I think we are ok for now (even for the jQuery footer because if the text is not too explainatory the query is: `hsMoveJQueryToFooter=true`).
i think we can actually inject extra explanations in the documentation if needed for detailed explanations (as we will dev. to improve that anyway so we can reuse a functionally instead dev. more)
for example I can see someone asking what debug does because it is not self-explanatory and you need to know where to look at
Yea I agree. and yea I’ve thought of tooltips, just not sure how we’d incorporate them, we already have the hover effects.
I only can see them working after the hover effect like in a corner or something. But I don't really feel confident about the place/mechanism
if we agree on dev. an extra page in the documentation to expand the information I think there is not need for tooltips
I’ll start building out a wiki page for explaining the features. Then find a place to add a link to it in the extension.
you have a lot of free time :sweat_smile:
I feel like it should be in the options page because there’s nothing substantial there but I feel like that might be too hidden at the same time…
eh it’s more that I’m enjoying it, and am shuffling around some other unimportant things I have to do.
I agree with your feelings about hiding the link in the options page:thinking_face:

For fun here’s some stats on how the extension is doing:
<https://spin.d.pr/qF2vTL+>
<https://spin.d.pr/DmeUwg+>
<https://spin.d.pr/qdJ10l+>
<https://spin.d.pr/UOL6bF+>
if we can handle the first-run functionally (like a more explanatory popup that will run only once) I would be okay if it's only in the opt. page after that
oh thats cool actually
good news from the stats is - most people must find it useful, only a handful of uninstalls and 2 of  4  those people didn’t have english as their primary language.
and 40 current users
yea it’s a possible solution, just want to avoid it being too over the top. “tutorials” in websites and web apps have been known to increase bounce rates.
UK, Belgium and Philippines is my team :stuck_out_tongue:
well not all of them probably
AHH! I have an idea!

We’ve discussed displaying a notification of some kind for notifying of changes. well what if we do that for the first time it’s opened too, use the same mechanism and simply link to the wiki explaining the extension through there
thats a good option, yeah
seeing the other countries there is what gave me the desire to do multi-lingual.  clearly there are people who’s primary language is not English who develop on HS
sure
plus after looking at the docs for how to do multi-lingual I was like - this is surprisingly easy, especially for a small extension like ours.
the only hard part is just getting people who know the languages to help out so we don’t up with orcish labels for buttons.

not gonna lie, in testing the multi-lingual, I’m like. I might just leave my computer in german or spanish mode for awhile, just for fun.

<https://spin.d.pr/dSMJ26+>
my favorite is the Umlaut on the cache buster button in german
and Debuggen is a fun word too

:grin: agree.
But I can't even imagine how to pronounce fußzeile
the B looking character is pronounced like an english “ss” sound fooss-zye-Leh
it’s hard to pronounce that word and then jquery right after it’s like a tongue twister

Anyone who doesn’t understand what a button or feature of the extension does, I’ve created a brief wiki page that explains all of it.

<https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/Feature-Breakdown>
